She presented with a severe gastrointestinal (GI) bleed, characterized by bloody stools and a drop in hematocrit levels. If the patient continues to bleed, further diagnostic procedures such as a red tag scan and angiography may be necessary. 

The patient also has a history of hypertension, for which she normally takes Lisinopril. However, this medication will be held until her hematocrit and hemodynamic status stabilize. The patient is being closely monitored in the ICU overnight for hemodynamic stability and frequent hematocrit checks.
